alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 09 at 12:25PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade County through 130 PM EST... At 1223 PM EST, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong showers along a line extending from Hialeah to near Homestead Bayfront Park. Movement was south southwest at 25 to 30 mph. These strong showers will move into rest of the eastern metro areas of Miami-Dade County through early this afternoon. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Miami, Hialeah, Miami Beach, Homestead, Coral Gables, Key Biscayne, South Miami, Homestead Miami Speedway, Black Point, Miami Gardens, Turkey Point, Virginia Key, Kendall, North Miami, Doral, North Miami Beach, Miami Lakes, Pinecrest, Opa-Locka and Miami Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the strong showers pass. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Miami. You can also share your report with NWS Miami on Facebook and Twitter.
